publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3126# Christine Grahame: Re-opening of Reston Railway Station-That the Parliament supports the campaign by RAGES for the re-opening of a railway station at Reston in Berwickshire, the former station having closed in 1964; notes that many Borderers currently commute by car to either Berwick or Dunbar to then travel citywards by train; further notes that there is agricultural land available for a new-build station and parking and that for a small sum, in the order of £10,000, a feasibility study into the re-opening of a station at Reston could be undertaken, and considers that the Scottish Executive should commission such a study now. Supported by: Brian Adam*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Fergus Ewing*, Colin Campbell*, Michael Matheson*, Bruce Crawford*, Michael Russell*, Roseanna Cunningham*
